column5: Got me a new toy fer chasin' de fishes!!!! Gonna rig her up today and then hit the salt!!!
sweet nice kayak Dave and when you get back home you got a smokin toboggan to boot. Enjoy the warm weather and the excellent saltwater fishing.     Art
Can you tow it behind your sled?
Will you fit in it?
Plenty of room Berger!!! I think you may even fit.
Plenty of room Berger!!! I think you may even fit.  I don't know. Like my Scottish grandmother used to say, "you can't put a quart into a pint pot!"
I hear its not bad on fuel. congrats bud
Plenty of room Berger!!! I think you may even fit. Just put him in the "trunk" he can make motorboat noises for you.   Art
I don't know. Like my Scottish grandmother used to say, "you can't put a quart into a pint pot!"  Now thats funny right there.  Thats the one I want Dave. Sweet buy.
Just put him in the "trunk" he can make motorboat noises for you.   Art   A baby might fit
Got her all rigged up today. Hope to hit the water in the AM. Installed depth finder, 3 rod holders, my milk crate and anchor trolley.
I can't remember the last time I saw a car without being encrusted in road salt.
Remember this guy?  Some language.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IaDBynIpbqM
Mike are saying you butt is bigger than a milk crate ? lol   Good luck fishing Dave.    Art
Got her out for a couple of hours paddling and a few casts this morning.
Got her out for a couple of hours paddling and a few casts this morning.   Looks sweet Dave.Will you have enough season to use both boats?
How fast is that bugger gonna fly... while being towed behind the sled when you get home...
Looks sweet Dave.Will you have enough season to use both boats?  Only if summer falls on a weekend.  Art
You rigged that up just nice. I,ll bet it was easy in those temps.LOL

Here's a short vid of her in action!! Taken with my new Bullet HD Pro 2 action cam. Facebook compression kinda messes up the quality a bit though.   https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=838883672804640&l=2564766510020149087
You rigged that up just nice. I,ll bet it was easy in those temps.LOL  Easy? Hardly!!!! I was sweating me arse off!!!!
Can't say I pegged you for a yakfisher Dave.  Once we put a bit of thought into it, we all know of somewhere they are better suited to than a motorboat or shore fishing.  Have fun!
It'll be perfect for some of the smaller lakes as well as our slower rivers back home. Be good for messing around at the cabin too.
I dunno Dave...I can kind of imagine you on an Alaskan river with that thing.
